net.jodah.failsafe

Class FailurePolicy<S,R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.jodah.failsafe.PolicyListeners<S,R>
      • net.jodah.failsafe.FailurePolicy<S,R>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - self type
    R - result type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Policy<R>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DelayablePolicy, Fallback

    public abstract class FailurePolicy<S,R>
extends PolicyListeners<S,R>
implements Policy<R>
    A Policy that captures conditions to determine whether an execution is a failure.

    If no handlers are configured, the execution is considered a failure if an Exception was thrown.

        public S handle(Class<? extends Throwable> failure)
        Specifies the failure to handle. Any failure that is assignable from the failure will be handled.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if failure is null

        Specifies the failures to handle. Any failures that are assignable from the failures will be handled.

        IllegalArgumentException - if failures is empty
